div.p: Rather than "making Outgroup eat shit", think of it as "defending Ingroup from Outgroup's nefarious plans".
The general worldview underlying Trump support (as I see it) goes something like:

ul.li: the Left has an active agenda for subjugating the Right in politics and destroying its way of life, and is currently engaged in implementing that agenda
despite winning many elections, the Right has not succeeded in rolling back or permanently damaging that agenda; the best result has been a clearly-temporary stalemate
this is because the Right's standard-bearers have been systematically unwilling to vigorously oppose that agenda, even when given the power to do so
they're unwilling to do that because the Left uses control of information outlets to smear any opposition to the Left's aggressive agenda as being immoral
thus, an effective standard-bearer for the Right must be willing to ignore the Left's claims of immorality, no matter how persistent or universal
Trump is the only significant Rightist politician in (a while) to show willingness to do this

div.p: Rightists are willing to support Trump, despite all his flaws, because he's seen as an effective fighter against the Left. And the reason they're so desperate for an effective fighter is because they see the Left as holding a commanding position, actively plotting to use it to harm the Right, and the existing Right as being devoid of any strong defenders.

You can quibble with the real-world correctness of this worldview -- it certainly is wrong in at least some details -- but I hope this helps you understand something about what Trump supporters are thinking.
